required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Vaccination Against COVID-19 in Brazil: Case-Control Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Vaccination Against COVID-19 in Brazil: Case-Control Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The Immunobiological Technology Institute (Bio-Manguinhos) / Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz)

clinical_study.source: The Immunobiological Technology Institute (Bio-Manguinhos) / Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz)

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccine against covid-19, recommended by the national immunization program. This is a multicentric, observational, case-control study. Participants Cases with the disease will be compared to Control Participants, that is, without the disease, regarding the vaccination history for Covid-19.Complementarily, an evaluation of cellular and humoral immunity will be carried out in a sample of both case and control participants, taking into account the vaccination history.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
primary_outcome.description: confirmed disease (RT-PCR positive for SARS-CoV-2), according to the clinical spectrum (of mild disease , moderate to severe) and outcome (disease-related death).

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
primary_outcome.description: according to the vaccine used, the number of doses and the interval from the last dose to the onset of symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
primary_outcome.description: according to the presence of comorbidities and medication use.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the vaccination against COVID-19.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the humoral and cellular immune response
secondary_outcome.description: in vaccinated or unvaccinated cases compared to vaccinated or unvaccinated controls.
including those related to the adaptive immune response (HLA molecules) and genetic aspects, in severe cases/deaths associated with vaccine failures.

arm_group.description: Individuals aged 18 years or older, with a suspected clinical picture of COVID-19 virologically confirmed, that is, with positive RT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 in a respiratory secretion sample collected in the first 7 days of the onset of symptoms , who did not have a positive RT-PCR result for SARS-CoV-2 in the 90 days preceding enrollment in the study.

Individuals residing in the vicinity of the case, aged 18 years or older, without a suspected clinical picture of COVID-19 and with RT-PCR negative for SARS-CoV-2 in a respiratory secretion sample collected at the time of inclusion, followed by confirmation of the absence of signs and symptoms suggestive of COVID-19 within the next 7 days.
a convenience sample composed of all cases exposed or not to vaccination and 200 controls, 100 vaccinated and 100 unvaccinated, for analysis of humoral response.
a sample of 100 vaccinated cases and 100 unvaccinated cases followed prospectively, and 100 vaccinated controls 100 unvaccinated controls assessed spot-on at enrollment.

arm_group.arm_group_label: analysis of potential genetic risk factors for the occurrence of severe forms of COVID-19 (SRAG)

study_pop.textblock: Participants virologically confirmed incident cases of COVID-19 and Control Participants without COVID-19 (no suspected symptomatology and RT-PCR negative for SARS-CoV in two consecutive naso/oropharyngeal swab samples).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Agreement to participate in the study after reading, understanding and signing the informed consent.
- Availability and possibility of being followed up during the follow-up period defined in the study, through visits to research centers, home visits, telephone contacts or other means of digital communication.
- Completing the case or control definitions described below.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Behavioral, cognitive or psychiatric illness that, in the opinion of the responsible investigator or his/her medical representative, affects the participant's ability to understand and comply with the requirements of the study protocol;
- Any other condition that, in the opinion of the responsible investigator or his/her medical representative, may jeopardize the safety or rights of a potential participant or prevent him/her from complying with this protocol.
